title: Multiplier effect of increase in investment

content.question: If there is no crowding out, a <math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in investment in physical capital will most likely lead to a

choices.label: less than <math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in aggregate supply
more than <math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in aggregate demand
<math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in aggregate demand
<math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in aggregate supply
<math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in the money supply

content.answer: more than <math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion increase in aggregate demand

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
